pal 0.0.9049
  • Reference

Convert to a character vector

Source: R/pal-GEN.R
as_chr.Rd

Recursively applies as.character() to its inputs.

as_chr(...)

Arguments

...

The R objects to be converted to a character vector. Dynamic dots are supported.

Value

A character vector.

See also

Other string functions: as_string(), cat_lines(), dsv_colnames(), escape_lf(), fuse_regex(), prettify_nr(), prose_ls(), str_replace_file(), str_replace_verbose(), wrap_chr()

Examples

to_convert <-
  list(tibble::tibble(a = 1:3), "A", factor("wonderful"), xfun::strict_list("day")) %T>%
  print()

#> [[1]]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#>   <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "A"
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] wonderful
#> Levels: wonderful
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "day"
#> 
#> 

as.character(to_convert)

#> [1] "list(a = 1:3)" "A"             "1"             "list(\"day\")"
as_chr(!!!to_convert)

#> [1] "1"         "2"         "3"         "A"         "wonderful" "day"
